00193     : nodes_(0),
00194       front_(0),

00202    /*
00203    * Provide a C array of Node<Data> objects for this List.
00204    */
00205    template <typename Data>
00206    void List<Data>::initialize(Node<Data>* nodes, int capacity)
00207    {
00208       nodes_    = nodes;
00209       capacity_ = capacity;
00210       setEmpty();
00211    }

00214    * Get number of elements in list.

00217    inline int List<Data>::size() const
00218    {  return size_; }

00221    * Get capacity of underlying array.

00223    template <typename Data>
00224    inline int List<Data>::capacity() const
00225    {  return capacity_; }

00227    /*
00228    * Push a node onto the the back of the List.
00229    */
00230    template <typename Data>
00231    void List<Data>::pushBack(Node<Data>& node)
00232    {
00233       if (back_ == 0) {
00234          node.setList(*this);
00235          front_ = &node;
00236          lower_ = &node;
00237          upper_ = &node;
00238       } else {
00239          back_->attachNext(node);
00240          expandBounds(node);
00241       }
00242       back_ = &node;
00243       node.setNext(0);
00244       ++size_;
00245    }
00246 
00247    /*
00248    * Push a node onto the the front of the List.
00249    */
00250    template <typename Data>
00251    void List<Data>::pushFront(Node<Data>& node)
00252    {
00253       if (front_ == 0) {
00254          node.setList(*this);
00255          front_ = &node;
00256          back_ = &node;
00257          lower_ = &node;
00258          upper_ = &node;
00259          size_  = 1;
00260       } else {
00261          front_->attachPrev(node);
00262          front_ = &node;
00263          expandBounds(node);
00264          ++size_;
00265       }
00266       node.setPrev(0);
00267    }
00268 
00269    /*
00270    * Remove a node from the back of the list.
00271    */
00272    template <typename Data>
00273    Node<Data>& List<Data>::popBack()
00274    {
00275       if (size_ == 0) {
00276          UTIL_THROW("Attempted popBack from empty List");
00277       }
00278       assert(back_  != 0);
00279       assert(front_ != 0);
00280       Node<Data>& oldBack = *back_;
00281       if (back_ == front_) {
00282          back_->clear();
00283          setEmpty();
00284       } else {
00285          back_ = oldBack.prev();
00286          back_->setNext(0);
00287          contractBounds(oldBack);
00288          oldBack.clear();
00289          --size_;
00290       }
00291       return oldBack;
00292    }
00293 
00294    /*
00295    * Remove a node from the back of the list.
00296    */
00297    template <typename Data>
00298    Node<Data>& List<Data>::popFront()
00299    {
00300       if (size_ == 0) {
00301          UTIL_THROW("Attempted popFront from empty List");
00302       }
00303       assert(front_ != 0);
00304       assert(back_  != 0);
00305       Node<Data>& oldFront = *front_;
00306       if (front_ == back_) {
00307          front_->clear();
00308          setEmpty();
00309       } else {
00310          front_ = oldFront.next();
00311          front_->setPrev(0);
00312          contractBounds(oldFront);
00313          oldFront.clear();
00314          --size_;
00315       }
00316       return oldFront;
00317    }

00319    /*
00320    * Insert newNode into the list after previous.
00321    */
00322    template <typename Data>
00323    void List<Data>::insertNext(Node<Data>& previous, Node<Data>& newNode)
00324    {
00325       if (&previous == back_) {
00326          back_ = &newNode;
00327          newNode.setNext(0);
00328       } else {
00329          previous.next()->attachPrev(newNode);
00330       }
00331       previous.attachNext(newNode);
00332       expandBounds(newNode);
00333       ++size_;
00334    }
00335 
00336    /*
00337    * Insert newNode into the list before next.
00338    */
00339    template <typename Data>
00340    void List<Data>::insertPrev(Node<Data>& next, Node<Data>& newNode)
00341    {
00342       if (&next == front_ ) {
00343          front_ = &newNode;
00344          newNode.setPrev(0);
00345       } else {
00346          next.prev()->attachNext(newNode);
00347       }
00348       next.attachPrev(newNode);
00349       expandBounds(newNode);
00350       ++size_;
00351    }
00352 
00353    /*
00354    * Remove a specific node from the list.
00355    */
00356    template <typename Data>
00357    void List<Data>::remove(Node<Data>& node)
00358    {
00359       assert( &node.list() == this );
00360       if (&node == back_) {
00361          if (back_ == front_) {
00362             back_->clear();
00363             setEmpty();
00364             return;
00365          } else {
00366             back_ = node.prev();
00367             back_->setNext(0);
00368          }
00369       } else
00370       if (&node == front_) {
00371          front_ = node.next();
00372          front_->setPrev(0);
00373       } else {
00374          node.prev()->setNext( node.next() );
00375          node.next()->setPrev( node.prev() );
00376       }
00377       contractBounds(node);
00378       node.clear();
00379       --size_;
00380    }
00381 
00382    /*
00383    * Insert one new node.
00384    */
00385    template <typename Data>
00386    void List<Data>::insert(Node<Data> &node)
00387    {
00388       //List<Data>& list = node.list();
00389       Node<Data>* current;
00390       Node<Data>* target;
00391 
00392       // Assert that node does not already belong to this list
00393       assert( &node.list() != this);
00394 
00395       // If list is empty
00396       if (front_ == 0) {
00397          node.setList(*this);
00398          front_ = &node;
00399          back_ = &node;
00400          lower_ = &node;
00401          upper_ = &node;
00402          size_  = 1;
00403          return;
00404       }
00405 
00406       // If node address is above highest address
00407       if (&node > upper_) {
00408          target = upper_->next();
00409          upper_->attachNext(node);
00410          upper_ = &node;
00411       } else // If node address is below lowest address
00412       if (&node < lower_) {
00413          target = lower_->prev();
00414          if (target) {
00415             target->attachNext(node);
00416          } else {
00417             node.setPrev(0);
00418             node.setList(*this);
00419             front_ = &node;
00420          }
00421          target = lower_;
00422          lower_ = &node;
00423       } else // If between lowest and highest addresses
00424       {
00425          current = &node;
00426          do {
00427             assert(current > lower_);
00428             --current;
00429          } while (&current->list() != this);
00430          target = current->next();
00431          current->attachNext(node);
00432       }
00433 
00434       // Set Next for new Node, or set to back_
00435       if (target != 0) {
00436          node.attachNext(*target);
00437       } else {
00438          node.setNext(0);
00439          back_ = &node;
00440       }
00441 
00442       ++size_;
00443    }
00444 
00445    /*
00446    * Set iterator to front of list.
00447    */
00448    template <typename Data>
00449    void List<Data>::begin(ListIterator<Data> &iterator) const
00450    {
00451       assert(front_ != 0);  
00452       iterator.setCurrent(front_); 
00453    }
00454 
00455    /*
00456    * Check validity of linked list.
00457    */
00458    template <typename Data>
00459    bool List<Data>::isValid() const
00460    {
00461       if (front_ == 0) {
00462 
00463          if (size_  != 0) {
00464             UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: front_ == 0 and size_ != 0.");
00465             return false;
00466          }
00467 
00468          if (back_  != 0) {
00469             UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid:  front_ == 0 and back_ != 0.");
00470             return false;
00471          }
00472 
00473          if (lower_ != nodes_ + capacity_) {
00474             UTIL_THROW("front_ == 0 and lower_ != nodes_+capacity.");
00475             return false;
00476          }
00477 
00478          if (upper_ != nodes_ -1) {
00479             UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: front_ == 0 and upper_ != nodes_-1.");
00480             return false;
00481          }
00482 
00483       } else {
00484 
00485          int i=1;
00486          Node<Data>* prev = 0;
00487          Node<Data>* node = front_;
00488          while (node->next() != 0 ) {
00489             if (node->prev() != prev) {
00490                UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid:  node->prev() != prev.");
00491                return false;
00492             }
00493             if (&node->list() != this) {
00494                UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: &node->list() != this.");
00495                return false;
00496             }
00497             if (node > upper_) {
00498                UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: node > upper_.");
00499                return false;
00500             }
00501             if (node < lower_) {
00502                UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: node < lower_.");
00503                return false;
00504             }
00505             prev = node;
00506             node = node->next();
00507             ++i;
00508          }
00509 
00510          if (i < size_) {
00511             UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: # elements < size_.");
00512             return false;
00513          }
00514          if (i > size_) {
00515             UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: # elements > size_.");
00516             return false;
00517          }
00518          if (node != back_) {
00519             UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: Last node != back_.");
00520             return false;
00521          }
00522          if (node->next() != 0) {
00523             UTIL_THROW("List<Data>::isValid: Last node, node->next() != 0.");
00524             return false;
00525          }
00526 
00527       }
00528       // If no errors were detected to this point, the list is valid.
00529       return true;
00530    }

00532    // Private methods
00533    
00534    /*
00535    * Set list to empty state.
00536    */
00537    template <typename Data>
00538    void List<Data>::setEmpty()
00539    {
00540       size_  = 0;
00541       front_ = 0;
00542       back_  = 0;
00543 
00544       // Set lower above all addresses and upper below all so that the
00545       // expandBounds method will reset both values when a node is added.
00546       lower_  = nodes_ + capacity_ ;
00547       upper_  = nodes_ - 1;
00548 
00549    }
00550 
00551    /*
00552    * Update upper_ and lower_ bounds for a new node.
00553    */
00554    template <typename Data>
00555    void List<Data>::expandBounds(Node<Data>& node)
00556    {
00557       if (&node > upper_) {
00558          upper_ = &node;
00559       }
00560       if (&node < lower_) {
00561          lower_ = &node;
00562       }
00563    }
00564 
00565    /*
00566    * Update upper_ and lower_ bounds to reflect removal of a node.
00567    */
00568    template <typename Data>
00569    void List<Data>::contractBounds(Node<Data>& node)
00570    {
00571       if (&node == upper_) {
00572          do {
00573             --upper_;
00574          } while ( &(upper_->list()) != this );
00575       }
00576       if (&node == lower_) {
00577          do {
00578             ++lower_;
00579          } while ( &(lower_->list()) != this );
00580       }
00581    }
